content.label:
this is very easily my favorite puzzle platformer available on the ios. if you're looking for something with a bit of humor, a sci-fy story you can dive into, platforming and some very creative puzzles - you owe it to yourself to check this one out.

and thank you GameClub for updating the controls.
=D
It‚Äôs bad no good
I found the controls so frustrating I soon gave up.
Definently worth the money, one of my favorite games, has a great atmosphere to itüòÅ

Fun experience, challenging puzzles, great controls and amazing graphics. Can't ask for more in an iOS game.

Also on a side note- ignore the reviews that state the puzzles are too hard sometimes. These puzzles are challenging but it's nothing difficult like in Year Walk. if you get stuck, Helios will help you.
I don't know why people gave good reviews on this game.  Really boring and waste of money...  Do not buy unless u r Super rich!
Great game with easy controls. It would get a 5 star review if they would make it longer. I finished the game in two days

This is not the best game you will ever play, despite what some seem to mistakenly think. It is okay. For its cost, I'd say its worth it.. The devs did a pretty okay job to make an interesting and mildly challenging puzzler.  The game is worth about four stars, but I rate here 3 (contemplating 2) due to the absolutely horrible controls. Moving and actions is clunky when your finger taps to grow a bomb for instance but instead hits the nearby sign that reads some snide, unfunny comment by the pseudo bureaucracy The Corporation. 

Poor humor and terrible controls aside, give this game at if you have the money to spare.

I recommend trying the controller style controls before the default setting. There are some irritatingly difficult parts and it's mainly because the controls are unorthodox. I am definitely looking forward to a part 2.

title.label: Flashing lights are distracting from what could be a good game

content.label: That is all

I LOVE this game , but I am so stuck!!! The level with the swinging orbs that need to be simultaneously hit in order to get the red power ball; I can't do it. I even read the writers clues... Didn't work. I've been working on this challenge for 2 weeks now. I would think that maybe I'm just lame, but I'm also playing Unmechanical right now and there were 2 puzzles to figure out that I thought were really hard. The first took me about 4 days to get thru, the second about 30 min., but I did it.  I'm at sunshine system; fate. Any suggestions?

Though it's got some rough edges - weird controls (that you will get used to), cliche and unnecessary story elements (oh no! The Corporation!!!), it's still a fun game to obsess over for a chunk of hours. 
If you are constantly searching for puzzle games (how do I advance to the next level???), you should give this one a whirl.
Also, innovative gameplay with spherical planets that you circumnavigate. No flat worlds here. 
RECOMMEND!
This game is so fun and is a good way to kill boredom. It has a unique concept and is enjoyable. Must buy for anyone with spare time or anyone who likes to play fun games. Great Game!

Cute, solid puzzle platformer but the controls take some getting used to. And if I read the credits correctly, one guy did everything and to me that is pretty impressive. I was going to give it 4 stars but he gets extra credit for the David Lynch mention and the Jean Michel Jarre references.

title.label: Mediocre at best, not worth the price

content.label: After reading the sterling reviews of this game I thought I'd give it a try.  The storyline is way too disruptive and interrupts gameplay with bad grammar and disjointed sentence fragments every minute or so.  The play gets boring really quickly as well.  Your money is better spent elsewhere.

Solid gameplay, very well written story. Crisp and gorgeous graphics!
How this game isn't being praised on iOS and any if not all video gaming websites is a literal crime against the medium. 
To the developer: Make more games, I will purchase each and every one of them! Your influences truly shine through in the gameplay without getting anywhere near the lines of completely ripping off there gameplay mechanics. Thank you for having the balls and artistic talent to make this game!
And seriously, make more!

title.label: This is in no way an exaggeration.

content.label: This is, put quite simply, the best game I have ever played. On any gaming system, ios device, or computer. The sheer beauty of it is astounding. The unique controls, the most addicting puzzles, and a bit of skill make this an experience that I have gone through 3 times. This is by far the most repayable game on my ipad. I'm shocked at how such a simple story could actually take a hold of me and captivate me for the hours I have spent on this game. The music and sound effects pull you in as if you really have control. Must get. I'm telling all of my friends about this... Really quite wonderful.

Fun game play and challenging puzzles. Kind of short though, finished all the levels within about a week of casual play. Also the controls to jump and run can be challenging to use. Hope to see more from Incoboto!

title.label: Really cute puzzle solver. Can get really frustrating.

content.label:
Disclosure: to all of you who just finished the game 100%: go back to WarmSun and turn it off. Don't be like me and wander through the game like a mad person.

It's really good. Once I got used to the unorthodox (one might even say crappy) controls I grew to appreciate them since the game was more difficult this way.  Such a lovely story, so much heart put into the puzzles, amazing graphics, etc. etc. 

Truly outstanding for an iOS game. But, I think my expectations were so high I was disappointed at the end (btw to all you lefties, you should be able to beat the game much easier than us poor right handed folk).
After hours of delighted and sometime frustrated play, I am confident saying this is the best game available in the App Store. Buy it now.

Incoboto may seem like just another cutesy platformer at first, but it's actually one of the more thoughtful and darker games I've ever played. It is indeed a hidden gem, and well worth your time and money.

I loved this game and felt it was well worth the money. The puzzles are fun and challenging and the story is engaging. The learning curve is very well graduated. Some of the puzzles are hard, but they all make sense and only a few require split second timing or a lot of running around.

Also tech support is amazing. I had a problem with the jetpack and within hours Dene suggested a workaround and found the bug and submitted a fix.
This was a very well made made game. It was very fun and challenging with funny elements mixed into an awesome storyline. Get it!

It's a really fun app, with sections that are challenging but not discouraging. The feeling when you solve a puzzle is the best thing.Worth the money. One question, I'm having trouble using the jet pack? I keep jumping than sliding my finger up but that isn't working. Suggestions?

title.label: Unique gameplay, challenging puzzles and engrossing storyline!

content.label:
I was really blown away by this game. The puzzles gradually increased in difficultly, and more often then not I found myself making the solutions much more difficult then they needed to be. It's frustrating when you can't solve a puzzle, but those proverbial "aha!" moments you have when you beat that s.o.b and snag that dangling star make you keep going back!

At first the spinning planets made me a bit queasy, so if you have any problems with your inner ear you may want to limit the time you spend with this game. Sometimes the touch controls didn't respond accordingly which was a tad frustrating, but I'm not sure if that's a game issue or dexterity issue on my part. 

All in all, the storyline was completely engrossing and I loved every minute I played. Related but not, trying to find walkthroughs to help on areas I was stuck on for DAYS I learned this entire game (including the soundtrack!) was created by one man. Yes, one, single, man-cub. Don't even bother trying to hype up the next game, Dene; shut up and take my money!!
Just replayed this fantastically made piece of greatness. Glad it made it on the greatest EVAR list.
Glad I bought this game. So many games of the same type out there and this is really unique.

title.label: Clever and well done game, marred by numerous imperfections

content.label: Played through entire game in less than a day, so it's a fairly small game. Most of the action involves trying to manipulate a very small character at the bottom center of the screen, which is wearing, particularly as the controls can be sloshy and imprecise. Crashed on my iPad 2 frequently, and brought down the whole machine a couple of times. There's a lot of reading unnecessary text, not to mention collecting puzzle pieces for no understandable purpose. Still, the obstacles are engaging, the pacing is great, and the graphics are pleasant.
Just finished at it was and is an Amazing experience.  So unique and different from other iOS gaming experiences.  Development at its best.  Thanks for this special game!

I was skeptical about this game but kept coming back to it, and I'm glad I did. It's got fun and challenging puzzles that aren't impossible. I love games that make you think but don't require you to find an online cheat. Definitely worth the money. Only suggestion would be to make the ending a little more substantial. Regardless still loved this game and hope they (he) make more like it (preferably #2)!

Incoboto is a lovely and charming game. It gives you a warm fuzzy feeling while you play it (as long as you are not stuck on a puzzle), and I enjoyed every moment of it.

My only complaint is that there is nothing more interesting than an achievement waiting for you when you collect all the star charts.

I confess, that I'm a bit of a cheater on these things, and often check the Web if I get stuck. There aren't a lot of tips or hints out there, though, so I had to gut it out -- and except for the final puzzle, where I did get one important tip on a forum, I figured it out! A couple of times I really thought I was stuck, but usually that was because I was expecting the solution to be more complex that it actually was. It can be frustrating, but try a variety of things!

Incoboto is somewhat disorienting and sometimes hard to track, but it is cute w/o being cutesy. The music is pleasant and the melancholy mood is a nice change. It could have a little more visual variety, but all in all, an amazing game for those who want something a bit different.

This game provides an interesting and engaging story with characters you connect with in a post apocalyptic universe all while providing a hook to keep you guessing and wanting to figure out what is going on.  This game is probably one of the best games on an iOS device and any other portable device for that matter.  I highly recommend this game to everyone, and future games should aspire to be just as good as this one.
Sort of like a platform puzzle game. Its short but enjoyable, and has a really unusual feel to it.

title.label: Interesting idea but the controls are garbage

content.label: I've been playing for a while and the controls are still a nightmare. Too bad because the concept is interesting. If you buy, prepare to be frustrated.
This game is pretty awesome. It's my favorite iPad game right now... I just wish they updated to the retina display already!

I just finished Incoboto for the first time (all 100 stars and all 50 star charts) and I look forward to going through it again soon. Great puzzle, great story, and only one developer! 

The only cons would be:
1) controls - I know it's designed for one finger play, but the controls still took a bit of getting used to.
2) glitches - the game had occasional glitches. The main one is anytime you minimize the game and come back to it later, it automatically shuts down and makes you restart it again. Sure, you start where you left off, but this happened every time I switched to a different app and then came back.

All in all, the pros to the game far outweigh the cons. Definitely in my top 5 of the year, and maybe my top 5 on iOS. If you like puzzle/platformer type of games, this is great.
Fun, I just wish collecting all the star maps served a purpose.

title.label: Beautiful game crippled by bad controls

content.label: A simple control system with arrows to move right and left, a jump and action button would have sufficed. But as it stands now, the two options for control just don't work. In situations when timing is crucial, you will just blow a fuse trying to jump and not grab something or vice versa.  It's really sad because everything else is as close to perfection as humanly possible. I know I would love this game if only I could control the character.
The game is so fun it almost makes the 5 crashes every 15 minutes worth it.
The graphics, sounds, story and gameplay all work well together and create an enchanting environment.  Love the game controls.  The sound effects are perfect!
Love the game style.

title.label: Wonderful game! But needs Retina update!

content.label: Gorgeous looking, wonderful soundtrack, and enjoyable game play. Only needs to be updated for retina display.

title.label: Lovely and challenging, high production value but a little crashy

content.label:
This is a FANTASTIC game. The game play, puzzles, art, interactivity and the music especially are phenomenal. Very high production value and design.

Unfortunately it suffers from all-too-often crashing on my iPad 2 running iOS 5.0.1. Also I find the controls a little frustrating at times with regards to manipulating objects but that's a small gripe.

Stellar (no pun intended) game over all, looking forward to bug fixes.
I love this game. The simple art style combined with sublime art direction, great controls, challenging puzzles, lonely story . . . Its great.
Absolutely terrific Metroid-ish game with a gorgeous art style and really good soundtrack. My favorite iPad exclusive.

I just finished the game after a few days, and I must say, very beautiful graphics, fun little puzzles to try and figure out along the way, great story (very different from anything I've seen) and kept my interest the entire time.  I was sad for this game to end!!  Recommended it to my brothers and sister, they'll love it as well!  This game and Machinarium are the two best games out there in my opinion...!  Worth every cent!

I seriously loved this game, we need more like it, absolutely beautiful job people!!!

I own many games and this one is at the top of my current list.  I recommend it for those that like Machinarium, Windosill, and Super Brothers Sword and Sorcery on the iPad.  The gameplay reminds me of Mario Galaxy, and the way the story is presented is in a fashion similar to the games I mentioned and Portal.  There are complexities to the game, like those found in the classics, Metroid and Zelda. It hits your emotions and draws you into the mystery of the storyline.  I feel some sadness in response to the storyline but there is also humor in dialog and I feel sympathy toward the main characters, Inco and Helios that It makes me want to keep playing, learn more, and help them.  The controls and graphics are very well done.  The music in the game reminds me of my sound soother from Brookstone, which makes this game very relaxing to play as well.
I am positive this game will be featured as an App Store Game of The Week, very soon!

I found this game dull and unchallenging. The controls weren't always precise, and the art is definitely nothing to brag about. I thought the sun's character was annoying and the idea that a corporation has left places destroyed but left signs is hardly new. See World of Goo, a much better game. 
Over all, I wish I could have my money back.

As I said it is a fun game but after a while it seems it crashes frequently.
I am tired of coming back to the game and being asked if I want to allow access to twiter then if I really want to pass on the Open Feint. Decisively not a multitasking app or a bullying app. Fail.
